author: ewedel

changelog.release_notes: Fix a high-latitude bug, where both edges of a twilight band are on the same side of midnight.
Add support for Time Round, and various bug fixes.
Use watch's DST setting (no more manual updates for DST changes), and make hour hand more visible at night on color screens.

Restore accidentally-removed automatic request of location data at each startup of watchface. This can be useful when the watch's cached location has become stale due to, e.g., travelling to some other location.
Pebble Time: clean up hour hand display, add low-battery indicator.
Adds support for the Pebble Time watch.
Enables basic watchface operation under iOS. Config pages are still not operating correctly however. Watchface remains fully functional with Android devices.
Minor update: fix missing semicolon reported by jslint.
Speculative fix for iOS missing location data / hang issue.
Add basic configuration pages to show and/or send current location to the watchface without needing to exit and reenter the watchface as before.
Release 2.0.1: Change so that initial display includes populated date and rise/set values: workaround for load hesitation in 1.x version is no longer needed.

description: A daily almanac for your Pebble. Displays lunar phase, sunrise and sunset times, and bands representing civil, nautical and astronomical twilight on a 24-hour watch dial. An hour hand shows the time of day on the watch dial. A digital display offers date and time, which honors your Pebble's 12/24 hour configuration.

latest_release.release_notes: Fix a high-latitude bug, where both edges of a twilight band are on the same side of midnight.

title: Twilight SunClock
